body:
*Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.

I am trying to install and use Spack on a CentOS 7 machines. I followed the instructions listed on the webpage to get started and ran into issues. I have used Spack on other machines and never run into this. I wonder if there is a missing dependence on this machine, but I am not getting useful debugging info.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

The first two command complete cleanly, but the third (and any other spack install <package> I have tried), results in an error. The error is the same in every case.

```console
git clone https://github.com/spack/spack.git
. spack/share/spack/setup-env.sh
spack install hdf5
```

### Error Message

```console
==> Error: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'version'
```


### Information on your system

 1. CentOS 7
 2. Minimal configuration (new server)
 3. Python 2.7.5

I suspect this is something simple, but I have not been able to pin it down. I tried this on another machine just to see if I could reproduce it and I could not. I suspect it is something lacking in the default configuration. Spack is often very good about that and gives very straight-forward error messages. For example, recently it told me that I needed to install patch.
title: Unable to install packages
